/Users/daa/legacy/src/libpg/trunk/simulators/SP38/generateCsvProcessorOutput.py

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 #! /usr/bin/python
00002 # This script will generate a csv file from the output of paramics processor-cmd.exe.
00003 # It will only leave the simulation messages with time, times real time and vehicles information separated by commas.
00004 # Author: Tony Lopes (tony.lopes@gmail.com)
00005 # Date: 15/02/2006
00006 
00007 import os
00008 import sys
00009 import re
00010 
00011 if len(sys.argv) < 4 :
00012     print 'usage: command <processor_output> <mean_each_mins> <output_file>'
00013     sys.exit()
00014 
00015 # Reading the file contents
00016 contents = open(sys.argv[1], 'r').read()
00017 
00018 # Cleaning invalid lines
00019 contents = re.sub("(?m)^(?!M:).*[\r\n]*","",contents)
00020 # Cleaning lines
00021 contents = re.sub("(M:)|(xRT)|V","",contents)
00022 # generating array
00023 vec_contents = contents.split("\n")
00024 # getting how many minutes will collapse
00025 mean_each_mins = int(sys.argv[2])
00026 tot_xRT = 0
00027 tot_veh = 0
00028 
00029 # Writing clean file
00030 out = open(sys.argv[3], 'w');
00031 
00032 for pos,data in enumerate(vec_contents) :
00033     splitted_data = data.split("|")
00034     if len(splitted_data) < 3 : 
00035         break
00036     tot_xRT = tot_xRT + float(splitted_data[1])
00037     tot_veh = tot_veh + float(splitted_data[2])    
00038     if (pos + 1) % mean_each_mins == 0 :
00039         out.write( splitted_data[0] +","+ str(tot_xRT / mean_each_mins) +"," + str(tot_veh / mean_each_mins) +"\n" )
00040         tot_xRT = 0
00041         tot_veh = 0
00042     
00043 
00044 contents = re.sub("\|",",",contents)
00045 contents = re.sub(" ","",contents)
00046 
00047 out.close()
00048
